result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David R.J. Hochstein

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward
from WI Forensic Unit to Court indicating Defendant failed to appear for examination

Cases called at 10:02 AM: 21CF1230, 21CM883, 22CF440.  Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant David R.J. Hochstein does not appear in person or via Zoom.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State notes that the doctor assigned to complete the competency examination filed a letter indicating that he has not been able to reach the Defendant. 
Court notes the Defendant was present when this date/time was given. Warrants ordered.
Court additionally notes that a competency examination will need to be re-ordered when the Defendant appears next.
Dated 09/20/2022, Letter from Dr. Craig Schoenecker to Court regarding competency evaluation status.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:09 AM cases 22CF440, 21CF1230 and 21CM883 called. Defendant David R.J. Hochstein appeared by video, in custody in the Dane County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrants are quashed and bond continues in all file. Defendant updates their phone number and address. Defendant needs to re apply to the SPD office for new representation. 
State raises competency- Court finds probable cause to order a competency evaluation in all files. 
A competency hearing is scheduled for 09/28/2022 at 10:00 AM in Branch 5. Defendant is permitted to appear via Zoom.

ADDRESS INFO for David R.J. Hochstein
Current: 1819 Aberg St., Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI 54703

(4:04 PM cases 21CM883, 21CF1230, 22CF440 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David R.J. Hochstein does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney James H Krave in court for David R.J. Hochstein.
Defendant is in custody in Monroe County and appearing on their court case currently.
State advises defendant prefers to be referred to as Litisha.
Court orders defendant is to be transported for further hearings.

11:00 AM cases 21CF1230, 21CM883, 22CF440 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David R.J. Hochstein not in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for David R.J. Hochstein. Defendant is in the Monroe County Jail. Clerk contacted the Monroe County Jail and advised them they will re schedule and Attorney Krave will get the defendant the new date. A hearing is scheduled for 6/30/22 at 4:00 PM (in person).
Hearing on June 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Hearing on May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(Case called at 11:16 AM- by Zoom) Defendant David Hochstein appears in custody via video conference from the Monroe County Jail without counsel. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises the Defendant of the charges and potential penalties. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived.
